intro: Conioselinum tenuissimum, commonly known as slender carrot grass, is a small annual herb native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic plants such as carrots and parsley. The plant typically grows to a height of about 10–30 centimeters, featuring finely divided, fern-like leaves and small white or greenish flowers. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in fields, roadsides, and waste areas. Its seeds are small and can be dispersed by wind, contributing to its widespread distribution.
